title: Rains: Heavy Rain and Swollen Rivers Cause Misery in Coastal Areas | Mangaluru News - Times of India
text: Mangaluru/Udupi: Continuing torrential rains disrupted normal life in major parts of Dakshina Kannada and Udupi districts, with swollen rivers causing inundation and displacement of people. The downpour particularly affected Belthangady taluk, and the residents in the catchment areas of Phalguni River.Dakshina Kannada DC Mullai Muhilan MP, who visited Belthangady and Venoor, said the heavy rain in Venoor, which was more than 450mm and Phalguni catchment areas, caused inundation along the river, till the city. He said Kuloor and Addepady were affected, and some people were shifted to relief centres. Even at Marodi village in Belthangady taluk and Ammunje in Bantwal taluk, people in inundated areas were shifted to safer places. The DC said many areas witnessed minor landslips. A short bridge collapsed at Mudale on the Maddadka-Padangadi road in Panjimogaru area.DK district received 107mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours till Thursday morning, as against normal average of 38mm. Moodbidri taluk received 198 mm of rainfall and Belthangady received 150mm of rainfall. Intense rainfall in Udupi district resulted in flood like situation, with Shambhavi River overflowing due to overnight rain. Rains affected villages like Inna, Dasakatte, Palimar, Mundkoor and Sanoor, and areas in Karkala like Jodu Rasthe, Kukkundoor, Kuntalpady road and Anekere. A couple of families, in all 44, in each of the areas had to be relocated or shifted due to inundation. In Kundapur taluk, 113 persons were shifted to safer places, and 10 were shifted relief centres and in Kaup taluk, 32 were shifted to safer places. Udupi DC Vidya Kumari K, who visited the flood-hit areas, said that the rain loss has been estimated at Rs 167 crore. Woman diesA woman died after her house collapsed following heavy rain on Thursday. The deceased is Gopi,66, from Borugudde. According to police, the victim, who was living in a tiled house, suffered injuries after the house collapsed on Wednesday night. She was rushed to the hospital, and succumbed to her injuries. Swollen rivers led to flooding and displacement. Key areas affected include Belthangady and catchment areas of the Phalguni river. Officials reported substantial damage to infrastructure, with relocating of residents to relief centers. The estimated financial loss was Rs 167 crore.112204057Normalcy returns in many taluks of Dakshina Kannada districtRainfall in Dakshina Kannada and Udupi districts ranged from 80mm to 221mm, affecting areas like Bantwal and Karkala. Landslides on NH169 caused brief traffic disruption. IMD issued alerts predicting further heavy rains. Over a dozen houses in Udupi faced damage. However, water levels in the Nethravathi river remained below danger levels despite inundation in certain areas.112175285Non-stop rain disrupts normal life, leaves several areas inundatedLife in Bhopal was disrupted on Friday as heavy rains continued until late afternoon. The Bhopal Municipal Corporation reported no significant submergence, with waterlogging confined to old city roads. Public transport and businesses were affected, but conditions improved by evening. Officials noted fewer distress calls, and people adjusted their routines to cope with the downpour.112054200
